name: places/ChIJqXdbV-ZYwokRDm470BgMx3w
formattedAddress: 328 E 59th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 328 E 59th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

editorialSummary.text: Brick-walled parlor featuring cuts & coloring services, including Japanese hair-straightening.

originalText.text:
After doing extensive research for a hair salon, I scheduled an appointment with Min for services including single color and cut and the head spa.

I asked for a haircut keeping as much of my length as possible. I wanted to shape it with long layers, a V or U shape, and face framing layers or curtain bangs. My hair was balayaged but I was looking to return to my natural hair color or deepen some of the balayage.

The entire experience was amazing and I definitely will be back. Min was very attentive to my requests and took her time to check on me and her work. The head spa was very relaxing and included a head, neck, and shoulder massage, warm towel and hair cleansing.

I am very grateful for Min’s time and expertise! I included before and after photos below.

originalText.text: Had a haircut by Yama! Usually go to Min who is great but decided to try a new stylist. Asked for some curtain bangs and hime trend which is new for me, turned out fantastic. Recommend, he is very precise and listens well

text.text: Had a haircut by Yama! Usually go to Min who is great but decided to try a new stylist. Asked for some curtain bangs and hime trend which is new for me, turned out fantastic. Recommend, he is very precise and listens well

originalText.text: I’ve come to T Gardens on 59th St for years. Being a full time practitioner, it is usually not feasible nor flexible scheduling anyappointments. But despite T garden being occupied at all times, staff are always accommodating and welcoming. I’ve done my hair by Tatsuya (owner) as well as different stylists depending on my schedule and they’ve all been exceptional and skilled. They are attentive to requests and exceed expectations. The products they use keep my hair feel nourishing and vibrant. There are numerous hair salons out there, but I definitely recommend this one!

originalText.text:
Gave this cool little hidden spot a try. It's been about a year since I've had a haircut, hard for me to trust any barber. I'm not sure I heard her name right if it was Kim or Lee (forgiveme), but she has gifted hands. I showed her an old picture of a hairstyle I had before and went to town. In about an hours time with a wash, cut, trim, wash, massage, and a quick inspection. She made me a brand new person.
I highly recommend this little hidden spot if you are into full service by a welcoming staff and beautiful decor!

originalText.text: this was my first time at this salon and it was definitely amazing!! i’ve got my hair done before by another salon but it wasn’t nearly as good as this time was!! I got the Japanese Straightening done, and the whole process was about 4 hours long but it went by so fast that i didn’t even remember that it was 4 hours haha!!! my stylist Yama was sooo sweet and made sure that i felt comfortable, i was a little hot during the process and he made sure that i felt cool and at ease so that’s very nice to me!!! my hair legit feels so soft and nice and it’s so unbelievably straight, my hair has legit never looked like this before!! i definitely recommend this salon if you’re looking to get the straightening done or just any hair style in general :) i’m excited to see how my hair will look in the next few days once i’m able to wash it!! thank you again Yama for the amazing hair!
